intro: Bichenia reptans, commonly known as the creeping bichenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are typically ovate with a smooth surface and are arranged alternately along the stems. Bichenia reptans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
